intro: Bikkia australis var. commersoniana, commonly known as the Commerson's bikkia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, where it grows in temperate regions. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. It has heart-shaped leaves and prefers well-drained soil and partial shade. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
